basics.name: Amar LAMKADEM
basics.label: DevOps Engineer | Freelance
basics.summary: I am a passionate and experienced DevOps professional specializing in solving production deployment challenges and optimizing development environments. My expertise extends to creating robust and reproducible environments for renowned companies. I have significant experience with technologies and methodologies such as Kubernetes, Helm, Gitlab, Datadog, Sentry, SonarCloud, Ansible, Terraform, and many others. My career has allowed me to work with companies such as Eleven Labs, Coffreo, KeyOpsTech, Trusk, and Télémaque. Currently seeking new freelance opportunities, I am ready to bring my expertise to your project and help your team overcome DevOps-related challenges.

work.name: Optimy
work.summary: At Optimy, I took on various responsibilities related to infrastructure and CI/CD pipelines. I worked on migrating the legacy GoCD infrastructure to Bitbucket Pipelines, with detailed migration roadmap planning. I also developed a FluxCD POC with image building for different non-production environments up to production. An important part of my mission was to completely migrate domain name registrars from GoDaddy to Route53 and Cloudflare, ensuring more efficient and secure management. I supported and guided the development team on complex database performance issues with PHP, providing them with optimization solutions and methodologies.
highlights: Migration of legacy GoCD infrastructure to Bitbucket Pipelines
Implementation of FluxCD POC for multi-environment image building
Complete migration of registrars from GoDaddy to Route53 and Cloudflare
Supporting developers on database performance optimization with PHP
Technologies: AWS, Terraform, Kubernetes, Helm, GoCD, Bitbucket Pipelines, FluxCD

work.name: Eleven Labs
work.summary: I collaborated with Eleven Labs, an IT Services Company, for a client in the education sector. My main mission was to keep the various production applications up to date. I also worked on improving the release cycle by managing the four non-prod environments as well as the production environment. A significant part of my work involved reducing the technical debt accumulated over two years in the infrastructure. Additionally, I was responsible for performance optimization and implementing innovative solutions to enhance system stability and scalability.
highlights: Technologies: GCP, Jenkins, Helm, Docker, AWS, Terraform, Ansible

work.name: Coffreo
work.summary: Coffreo was undergoing restructuring and aimed to accelerate its DevOps efforts. Lacking internal expertise in k8s/helm technologies, my mission was to meet short deadlines for the complete migration of Coffreo's applications to OVH-managed k8s clusters using CI/CD and helm packaging. I also worked on implementing proactive monitoring to identify and resolve potential issues before they affect end-users.
highlights: Complete migration of applications to managed k8s clusters
Technologies: Docker, Helm, Gitlab, Datadog, Sentry, SonarCloud, backup, etcd, OVH, HELM

work.name: KeyOpsTech
work.summary: Support and maintenance of infrastructure on GCP. Mainly updating pipelines, adding new projects, and debugging existing projects. Evening and weekend contract at the rate of one day per week. I also worked on cost optimization by evaluating and adjusting cloud resources to ensure efficient usage without compromising performance.
highlights: Technologies: Gitlab CI, Docker, Helm, GCP, Ansible, Terraform

work.name: Trusk
work.summary: Trusk was at a critical stage for European expansion, with the goal of industrializing our tech to have a sustainable and robust infrastructure. My missions were varied, including consolidating the infrastructure, implementing Chaos Engineering and Zero Trust practices, and migrating microservices to Kubernetes with Helm. I also implemented disaster recovery strategies to ensure continuity of operations in case of a major incident.
highlights: Homogenizing infrastructure and migrating to GCP
Technologies: Kubernetes, GCP, Ansible, Helm, Terraform, Saltstack, AWS, DigitalOcean

work.name: Telemaque
work.summary: The company Télémaque undertook a major project in 2018 to change all old working methodologies. We moved from several unversioned codebases to complex and easily maintainable microservice applications. We migrated to the cloud with Google (GCP) to manage our park with VM instances, Cloud SQL, BigTable, and managed services. Additionally, I introduced agile development practices to enhance collaboration between development and operations teams.
highlights: Continuous Integration / Continuous Deployment with Jenkins pipelines
Technologies: Docker, Kubernetes, Helm, GCP, Jenkins, Terraform

work.name: Telemaque
work.summary: Handing over and managing a home-built CRM project following a departure. Managing our call reminder application to automate the telephone call workflow (Phoning, Callback, Client Appointment, Disputes) in multiple countries. Creating various applications to facilitate email communication to our users. I also implemented stringent security procedures to protect user data and ensure compliance with regulations.

Defining strategic vision and product roadmap
